title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Load R Package

library(tidyverse)
library(plotly)
library(ggthemes)
library(esquisse)
library(tidytuesdayR)


You must load packages every new R Session

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday

Visualization Resources
R Graphics Cookbook
R Graph Gallery
R Charts
ggplot2

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Tidy Tuesday
Tidy Tuesday is a weekly data vizualization challenge from the R 4 Data Science Online Community.

The goal is to make learning with real-world data easier.


New data sets are released every week to create awesome visuals.

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Week 6
This week looks at the number of heritage sites in 3 countries from the Unesco World Heritage Convention.

This is part of the 100 visualizations from 1 data set.

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Loading Data

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 6)

#> 
#>  Downloading file 1 of 1: `heritage.csv`

heritage <- tuesdata$heritage
heritage

#> # A tibble: 3 Ã— 3
#>   country `2004` `2022`
#>   <chr>    <dbl>  <dbl>
#> 1 Norway       5      8
#> 2 Denmark      4     10
#> 3 Sweden      13     15

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
heritage2 <- heritage |> 
  pivot_longer(!country, names_to = "year", values_to = "value")
ggplot(heritage2, aes(x = year, y = value, color = country)) + 
  geom_point() + theme_bw()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
ggplot(heritage2, aes(country)) + 
  geom_bar(aes(weight = value, fill = year)) + 
  theme_bw()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
library(ggpie)
heritage3 <- heritage2 |> uncount(value)
ggrosepie(heritage3, group_key = c("country", "year"),
             count_type = "full", label_info = "all",
             show_tick=F,donut_frac=NULL)

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
# devtools::install_github("davidsjoberg/ggsankey")
library(ggsankey)
heritage4 <- heritage3 |> make_long(country, year)
pl <- ggplot(heritage4, aes(x = x,                        
                     next_x = next_x,                                     
                     node = node,
                     next_node = next_node,        
                     fill = factor(node)))
                     
pl <- pl + geom_sankey(flow.alpha = 0.5,          #This Creates the transparency of your node 
                      node.color = "black",     # This is your node color        
                      show.legend = TRUE)        # This determines if you want your legend to show

pl <- pl + theme_bw()

pl

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
library(treemap)

treemap(heritage2,
        index=c("country","year"),
        vSize="value",
        type="index"
)

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
library(ggpie)
library(patchwork)


p1 <- heritage3 |> filter(year == 2004) |> 
  ggdonut(group_key = "country",
          count_type = "full") +
  ggtitle("Year 2004")
p2 <- heritage3 |> filter(year == 2022) |> 
  ggdonut(group_key = "country",
          count_type = "full") +
  ggtitle("Year 2022")
p1 + p2 +
  plot_layout(guides = 'collect')

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Downloading Data Data

u <- "https://www.inqs.info/p/plotathon/owenWilsonWows.csv"
basename(u)
download.file(u,
              file.path(getwd(), "data", basename(u)))

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Loading Data

mds <- read_csv("data/owenWilsonWows.csv")

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Base Plot

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie))

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Histogram

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_histogram()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Box Plot

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_boxplot()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Density Plot

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_density()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Box Plot By Category

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, y = era)) +
  geom_boxplot()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Density Plot By Category

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_density()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Scatter Plot

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Scatter Plot by Group

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie, color = era)) +
  geom_point()

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Add Regression Line

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Smooth Line

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(se = F)

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Regression Lines by Group

mds |> ggplot(aes(x = durationInSeconds, 
                  y = total_wows_in_movie,
                  color = era)) +
  geom_point() +
  geom_smooth(method = "lm", se = F)

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Tidy Tuesday
Tidy Tuesday is a weekly data vizualization challenge from the R 4 Data Science Online Community.

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Week 7
This week looks at the number of heritage sites in 3 countries from the Unesco World Heritage Convention.

This is part of the 100 visualizations from 1 data set.

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Loading Data

tuesdata <- tidytuesdayR::tt_load(2024, week = 7)

#> 
#>  Downloading file 1 of 3: `historical_spending.csv`
#>  Downloading file 2 of 3: `gifts_age.csv`
#>  Downloading file 3 of 3: `gifts_gender.csv`

historical <- tuesdata$historical_spending

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Historical Gifts

historical |> DT::datatable(options = list(pageLength = 5, dom = "tp"))

title: Tidy Tuesday on Wednesday
text:
Examples


Code
library(tidyverse)
historical_long <- historical |> 
    pivot_longer(cols = `PercentCelebrating`:`GiftCards`,
                 names_to  = "Variable", values_to = "Value") 

heartdf = tibble(
  t = seq(0, 2*pi, pi/60),
  x = (16*sin(t)^3)/3 + 2016,
  y = 13*cos(t) - 5*cos(2*t) - 2*cos(3*t) - cos(4*t) +30
)


p1 <- historical_long |> 
  filter(!Variable %in% c("PercentCelebrating", "PerPerson", "GreetingCards", "GiftCards")) |> 
  mutate(Variable = ifelse(Variable == "EveningOut", "Evening Out", Variable)) |> 
  ggplot(data = _) +
    geom_polygon(data = heartdf, aes(x, y, group = 1), fill = "red", alpha = 0.2) +
    geom_line(aes(x = Year, y =  Value, color = Variable)) +
    theme_bw() +
    ylab("Average Percent Spending") +
    xlab("Year") +
    theme(legend.title=element_blank()) +
    scale_x_continuous(breaks = c(2010, 2014, 2018, 2022))

p1
